title: custom main problems with time and loading plugins

content.raw:
If you take the [custom main](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d6bfa5238c7c0cb3963716df16475b97f1f0051b/examples/stand_alone/custom_main/custom_main.cc?at=default) example, and change `i < 2` to `i < 200000` the time and iterations in gzclient will not count correctly. 

Iterations will appear to run backwards from 100 down to 0 repeatedly, and real time will bounce around near 0, which is of course not the case. 

This image illustrates the problem, it was taken after running for about 1 minute:

![custom_main_bug.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/400736292-custom_main_bug.png)

It also seems that plugins may not load correctly from the world if I modify the custom main to load a more complicated .world file that includes a plug-in. 

I've also been able to verify this behavior with a significantly more complicated custom main that I have been implementing.

This is on OS X mavericks on the gazebo_3.0 branch, commit 9210f7bb0528.
